item.title: Manager- Data Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager- Data Analytics

Job Description

  • Obtain an in-depth understanding of HEF products and segments in order to effectively provide value-added insights
  • Build reporting that measures the success of new pricing strategies under Customized Pricing, measuring champion vs. challenger performance and make strategy recommendations
  • Utilize pricing optimization tool to create pricing proposal based on previous results and current rate environment.
  • Enhance the existing Tableau tools to incorporate on-going user feedback, deliver further efficiency through automation of processes and expose timely and relevant information to end-users
  • Work with the HEF Pricing team and others to advice on pricing decisions through use of reporting, leading edge analytics, measurement of key performance indicators, and early detection of trends & anomalies
  • Participate in building new predictive model to enable insights and facilitate pricing decision making process
  • Leverage data-driven tactics to provide key analytical and business insights to support senior leaders in managing the pricing strategy for the Home Equity portfolio
  • Create materials to communicate insights developed either through new reporting or specific stakeholder presentations and working sessions
  • Monitor the use of delegated pricing authorities to ensure compliance

Must-have  

  • 2-4 years of experience in an analytical and reporting capacity supporting a line of business across major Financial Institution(s).  
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and provide insights to senior management
  • SQL knowledge and experience, including developing and optimizing complex queries
  • Proficient in use of SAS, Tableau, Excel, PPT, or other data visualization tools
  • Self-starter—ability to work and think through problems and assignments in a self-directed manner
  • Excellent communication skills along with ability to partner effectively with and direct both internal and external partners

Nice-to-have

  • Passionate about the mortgage industry, and being part of a greater team
  • Knowledge of Data Science / predictive modelling / machine learning is an asset
  • Experience in Python and R programming
  • Knowledge of Linx, experience with RBC database and mortgage data  (only show on internal posting)

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, fair compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who help your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

Job Summary

RBC Home Equity Financing (HEF) is the leading lender of residential mortgages in Canada, and RBC’s single largest business with over $300 Billion in assets.
As the Manager, Data Analytics within HEF Pricing Team, you will use advanced analytics to provide senior leadership insights into the impacts of pricing strategies on the HEF portfolio. Also, you will maintain reporting package that focuses on the pricing aspect of the HEF business that will help drive key decisions with a high degree of impact. Furthermore, you will leverage pricing optimization tools to generate monthly pricing proposal under Customized Pricing strategies.

item.title: Snr Manager, Data Management Operations
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Snr Manager, Data Management Operations

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In this role of Senior Manager, Data Management, RBC Global Asset Management (GAM), you will partner with business leaders, data governance and project teams to ensure the completeness and accuracy of enterprise data within Global Asset Management, with a focus on one or more assigned data domains. Build trust and confidence across the organization around enterprise data and data processes. This position will play an important role in GAM’s vision to become a data driven firm, and will serve as a go-to expert for the data that is managed by GAM’s Data Governance, and how to leverage it for business value. For more information, please visit: https://www.rbcgam.com/en/ca/

What will you do?

  • Accountable for one or more specific enterprise data domains, you will work across the organization to understand enterprise data needs, data requirements and usage. Conduct research related to data requirements and present proposals to appropriate teams. Where needed, work across multiple business teams to achieve consensus on key data decisions including sourcing, classifications, and definitions.

  • Lead the work of one or more Data Working Groups, minute decisions and provide input to the Data Governance Council for key decisions that need to be escalated.

  • Define accountability for making data decisions – raise issues, risks and business decisions to appropriate teams.

  • Prioritize data work to ensure optimal value across projects and the organization

  • Join an agile data squad and provide guidance on data definitions, locations, and workflows.

  • Work with data squads to document and translate data requirements into technical requirements

  • Join an agile data squad and provide guidance on data within the organization.

  • In partnership with the data governance disciplines, business teams and business technology:

    • Document data definitions, create data quality controls and monitors

    • Develop data integration processes

    • Define operational workflows for maintaining data

    • Plan for data staging and delivery to reporting and downstream applications

  • Communicate regularly with project and business teams on data readiness and to identify data gaps and new requirement

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, IT/MIS/CS or related experience

  • Demonstrated reporting, data analysis experience, especially working with complex business processes and specific data domains

  • Strong communication, interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively with business users and technical individuals

  • Understanding of data flows, data architecture and data querying ability, including comfort with writing Oracle and MS SQL queries for data- mining and analysis

Nice to Have

  • Experience working in financial investment industry ideally within an asset management group

  • Decision making capabilities including problem solving approaches

  • Ability to solve specific business problems, while keeping an overall business and data vision in mind.

  • Experience working within a data warehousing environment.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Flexible work/life balance options

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

item.title: Full Stack Developer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Full Stack Developer

Job Description

  • What is the opportunity?

    In this role, you will lead and mentor a team of enthusiastic engineers building APIs and micro-services and front end applications. You will work with all stakeholders to design best in class technology solutions. 

    What will you do?

  • Develop and maintain APIs and micro-services and front end.
  • Develop and maintain front end apps using Angular framework (Angular 7 or above)
  • Lead and mentor an enthusiastic team of engineers.
  • Build reusable and fully tested (unit tests) code using Jest, Jasmine, Karma, Protractor.
  • Optimize applications for maximum usability and function.
  • Design highly scalable and extensible services
  • Create estimates for given tasks/features.
  • Design front end with the industry best practices.

  • What do you need to succeed?

    Must-have

  • Extensive experience in building Applications using Java-Spring Boot or Node.js, Angular, HTML, JavaScript, Redux, CSS, Kubernetes.
  • 2+ years of experience leading a team of engineers.
  • Strong proficiency in on-prem and/or public cloud and deployment.
  • Expertise with more than one database and related technologies (MongoDb, Elastic-Search, SQL server, Oracle, Kafka)
  • Experience with REST and/or GraphQL
  • Experience with modern dev-ops techniques experience is a must. We use GitHub, UrbanCode and Jenkins.

  • Nice to Have

  • Some experience with ReactJS

  • What’s in it for you?

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation and stock where applicable.
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • A startup like environment with all the job security of the number one financial institution.
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a friendly, dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.
  • A world-class training program
  • Fun and supportive environment that values personal aspirations as much as the results to be delivered.

item.title: Senior Application Support Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Application Support Analyst

Job Description

  • Ensuring that up-to-date job control language is maintained and documented for each program that is part of a scheduled production run.
  • Ensuring the documentation and tracking of all shift turnover issues.
  • Contributing to job scheduling and report distribution, as well as data center standards development and enforcement.
  • Monitoring the library to insure that the proper generation of data files are available for production runs and tracks resolution.

What will you do?

  • Responsible for ensuring maximum system availability, prompt and accurate remediation and response to issues and requests
  • Proactive management and governance of our applications
  • Leverage automation to drive efficiency and to improve the soundness of our operating environment
  • Ensure strict adherence to standard operating procedures, standing order guidelines, and governance best practices
  • Liaise/Partner closely between Business, Technology, Compliance, Surveillance, and Functional groups to help conduct regular review to help evolve our platform and to ensure the connectivity required to achieve our collective objectives
  • Responsible for ensuring maximum system availability and production stability
  • Responsible for rapid and precise remediation to issues with a bias towards automation and finding root clause.
  • Provide effective incident, problem and release management and regular project updates to stakeholders
  • Drive IT governance and de-risking initiatives
  • Deploy CI/CD pipelines across multiple environments into production
  • Lead effective knowledge sharing, documentation, and cross training to help maximize coverage and work to improve the robust of our follow-the-sun operating model

What do you need to succeed?

  • Must be extremely hands on, detail oriented, assertive and proactive with both day-to-day tasks and short and long-term deliveries
  • Proven ability to collaborate well with others, be strategically focused and realize continuous improvements
  • Prior in-depth experience in supporting large-scale, enterprise-wide, global trading and risk platforms
  • Consistently seeking to automate; Strong scripting skills (i.e., Python, PERL, etc.)
  • Solid working understanding of LINUX and SQL (including database concepts)
  • Good organization skills , ability to effectively context switch and thrive in a fast pace environment
  • Proficient in Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) and maintain DevOps standards
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills and self-starter attitude
  • Knowledge of messaging systems (i.e, Solace, MQ)
  • Knowledge of monitoring software (i.e. ITRS)
  • Knowledge of distributed software (i.e. Tibco DataSynapse)
  • Understanding of scheduling and build/deployment tools (i.e. Control-M, Jenkins)
  • Experience as a member of a team that is providing 24x7 coverage
  • Solid command of multi-assets (equities, equities derivatives, FX) systems.
  • Sophis experience is a plus or familiarity with complex risk systems.
  • Bachelors of Science degree or equivalent

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Opportunity to contribute to the growth and success of our business and work with the platforms, technologies, and people needed to achieve our ambitions
  • Collaborate closely with different stakeholders and in different lines of business across different business and regions.
  • Challenging and rewarding work on complex and mission critical platforms
  • Platform to actively drive change to drive continuous improvements
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Wide variety of activities and projects that will challenge and stretch your capabilities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

Job Summary

The Production & Risk Service group is looking for a seasoned application support analyst to help support and drive the operations of a group of complex front to back applications that is used to calculate PNL, manage risk, and reconcile positions for our Front Office, Risk, Finance and Operations groups. We support fast-paced global businesses with evolving needs and requirements. Your ability to take ownership of our production estate combined with a natural sense of curiosity and pride in a job well done will help you success in the role.

item.title: Senior Full Stack Developer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Full Stack Developer

Job Description

City National bank (CNB) is a full-service US bank that offers a complement of banking, trust and investment services. In 2015, City National merged with Royal Bank of Canada. The company continues to invest in new talent, products, technology and capabilities. We’re building a team who is not afraid to challenge the status quo; embraces innovation; and excited to bring a fresh perspective. We are hiring Senior Full Stack Developers to help deliver the CNB digital roadmap for the Wealth Management business.

What will you do?

  • Work within a cross functional agile team to build digital products
  • Contribute towards the creation of intuitive, robust, and reusable user interfaces
  • Look for opportunities to ideate and improve the product and continually expand what is possible through technology.
  • Participate in our community of development and challenge yourself and each other to innovate and improve each day
  • Design microservices that offer the data and services to both internal and external partners
  • Maintain code quality and best practices across the stack
  • Understand and consistently apply accessibility guidelines (WCAG)
  • Work with ambiguity and ask for feedback to drive to a solution as part of the team

What do you need to succeed?

  • A team player, technical advocate, keen to flush out and share ideas with your team
  • A creative problem solver that can develop a plan, take ownership and deliver solutions
  • An exceptional communicator able to articulate technical issues in plain language
  • Value your team’s success as much as your own as we celebrate and move forward as a team
  • Obsessed with clean code and best practices
  • You keep up to date on frontend and backend development trends
  • You understand web/application security and the importance of data privacy
  • You bring new ideas and solutions to the team to help solve our challenges

Must have:

  • 5 - 10 years’ experience working within a cross functional agile development team    
  • Solid grounding in OOAD and SOLID principles
  • You are familiar with TDD, BDD and have knowledge of testing frameworks
  • Deep experience with .NET Core, C#
  • Solid experience working with RESTful APIs, WebAPI
  • Expert knowledge of Angular, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, TypeScript, Bootstrap
  • Experience with Cloud: Docker, Kubernetes
  • Azure AZ-204 Certification or equivalent experience
  • Good understanding of data structures and experience with relational databases such as MS SQL
  • Bachelor\'s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Equivalent

Nice to have:

  • Experience working in the finance industry
  • Exposure to DevOps best practices 
  • Knowledge of product development methods
  • Experience with Azure Cloud Services such as ADF, AKS, Azure Functions

What’s in it for you? 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, fair compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who help your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Senior DevOps/Platform Engineer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior DevOps/Platform Engineer

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The platform engineering team believes in automating everything, making data-driven decisions, minimizing friction for platform adoption and most of all embracing change. We believe in collaboration, collective ownership and continuous improvement. Our team is supporting multiple large scale initiatives across the business from personal and commercial banking, investor and treasury, wealth management and insurance.

As a senior platform engineer you will be responsible to build out various big data platforms using Cloud, Hadoop and Container based technologies for real-time stream, batch processing and analytics. This role will take on challenges of scaling out systems for performance and multi-tenancy across all dimensions using cutting-edge technology.

What will you do?

  • Work on large scale clusters on premise and in the Cloud
  • Scale out clusters and services to many use cases and hundreds of applications
  • Design and build resilient and highly available multi-tenant solutions
  • Deploy and test out new technologies such as Kubernetes, Ozone, CDP Experiences
  • Desire to grow and learn Cloud based big data technologies
  • Automate and secure everything
  • Embrace change

What you need to succeed?

Must have

  • Bachelor\'s degree majoring in Computer Science, or related fields, or at least 5 years of related work experience
  • Experience with distributed systems, designing and building for resiliency and performance
  • Experience with building platforms on AWS and/or Azure cloud
  • Experience with container-based platforms
  • Automation via REST APIs
  • Automation via Python programming
  • Experience with Linux administration (CentOS, RHEL, Ubuntu)
  • Experience with Ansible, Git and general CI/CD tools and processes
  • Experience with network administration
  • Experience with system and network security best practices. 
  • Open mind, a desire to learn and to be challenged
  • Sound judgement

Nice to have

  • Experience with Spark, Hadoop and Kafka
  • Experience with tools like HBase, MongoDB and Presto
  • Experience with Hortonworks Data Platform (HDP)
  • Experience with Cloudera Data Platform (CDP)
  • Experience providing technical leadership to internal and external teams

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

item.title: Data Scientist
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Data Scientist

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In this role as a Data Scientist, you will analyze, design, and implement data science/machine learning solutions using RBC’s enterprise suite of analytics tools.  The group specializes in taking full advantage of large data sets to explore and discover new insights that would have not been possible with traditional analytics.  Leveraging leading-edge technologies and capabilities, the group applies machine learning and statistical modeling techniques to help RBC understand the changing business environment, discover new growth opportunities and determine where business improvements can be made.       

What will you do?

  • Work with business partners and stakeholders to understand the problem statement/business objective and accordingly develop machine learning algorithms to identify these complex threat scenarios that are able to evade traditional detection tools.
  • Prototype the algorithms for execution in the Hadoop environment, GPU and cloud environments.
  • Work with business stakeholders, internal and external QA to ensure that the final product is of the highest quality and is able to meet pre-defined business objects.
  • Collaborate with application development and data engineering team to deploy a scalable batch/real-time model to production.
  • Support the development of a proactive approach to threat detection and/or misuse identification.
  • Train and mentor junior employees when applicable.
  • Participate in Proof of Concept or Proof of Technology projects to evaluate cybersecurity technologies and platforms.
  • Operate third-party technologies to analyze security data and identify threats and misuse cases, and evaluate capabilities of those technologies.
  • Participate in the creation of detailed plans and accurate estimates towards the development, testing, and implementation of proactive threat detection capabilities.
  • Contribute to successful completion of projects by identifying risks and developing/recommending mitigation strategies.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have:

  • A background in Computer Science, Computational Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
  • Solid knowledge of general Machine Learning concepts both in theory and application and experience with advanced topics like Deep Learning, NLP, etc.
  • Experience with data preprocessing, feature and representation learning, and anomaly/outlier detection.
  • Advanced programming skills in one or more of the following languages: Python, R, Scala.
  • Experience with big data processing technologies like Spark.
  • Knowledge of Parallel Programming and High-Performance Computing.

Nice-to-have:

  • Knowledge of network and information security. 
  • Knowledge of the Hadoop and GPU ecosystem.
  • Advanced programming skills in one or more of the following languages: PyTorch, TensorFlow.
  • Ability to develop statistical tests and run controlled trials.

What’s in it for you?

  • We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

item.title: Sr. SQL Server Database Administrator Specialist
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr. SQL Server Database Administrator Specialist

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Data and Analytics (DNA) team is looking for a Senior SQL Server Database Administrator.  The DBA will oversee the creation and maintenance of database & transaction processing environments for application testing, pre-Production verification, and production operation. You will provide technical support for transaction processing, data access, performance tuning, and database recovery.  The Database Administrator will provide DBA services to a portfolio of applications across lines of business and across the whole RBC enterprise. 

What will you do?

  • Lead in the support of database and transaction management technology and it’s deployment and usage standards.
  • Lead application development and support teams in optimal use of database and transaction management technology through creation and communication of standards and walkthrough of critical application components.
  • Ensure that databases are optimally designed, so that applications meet their defined SLA s, reuse of existing database structures is maximized and operational costs are minimized
  • Provide leadership in ensuring all database and environmental changes are appropriately tested and implemented in such a manner that there is no impact on RBC systems and clients.
  • Provide strong technical knowledge and business subject matter expertise across a wide range of database technologies, with a primary focus on SQL servers. 
  • Provide database-related technical support for development and production environment including required level of 7X24 on-call support.
  • Define, develop and meet various SLAs for multiple database platforms used in the company.
  • Improve and optimize database administration and management with coding and automation with a focus on performance, high availability, reliability, and reduce TOIL using SRE practices.
  • Build self-service and self-managing capabilities of our database as a service infrastructure.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 10+ years of proven working experience in Microsoft SQL Server technology and current on SQL Server releases (i.e. SQL Server 2012, 2014, 2016, 2017, 2019)
  • In-depth technical knowledge of database and transaction management technologies and operating systems
  • Experienced with data manipulation languages, data definition languages, physical database design, and application performance analysis & tuning
  • Experience in providing L3/L4 support in troubleshooting SQL Server performance-related issues.
  • Expert knowledge to analyze performance issues, identify tuning opportunities, implement improvements and advise developers on SQL Server
  • Intermediate knowledge of support and maintaining SQL server on Linux platform 
  • Experience automating routine DBA tasks using scripts or CI/CD pipelines

Nice-to-have

  • Some knowledge of public cloud (i.e.
  • Some knowledge of  containerization
  • Managing SQL Server on containers (i.e. Docker, Kubernetes, etc…)
  • Nice to have other NoSQL Databases platforms
  • Knowledge of DevOps pipeline (i.e. git and JIRA)
  • Coaching/mentoring skills
  • Good verbal and written communication skills
  • Attention to client focus and client service

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. 

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities         
  • Opportunities to build close relationships with clients
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

item.title: Lead Front End Developer (OMNI)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Lead Front End Developer (OMNI)

Job Description

Our clients are unique and their digital banking experience should be one-of-a-kind. At RBC Digital, we want our clients to feel empowered when they interact with us. We’re investing in technologies and data insights to evolve as our clients do. We’ve joined our product, design and technology teams to collaborate to deliver an innovative personalized user experience. Being a part of our Digital Team means you’ll join a culture of creativity, curiosity, and continuous learning.

We’re envisioning the future of banking and building the core platforms to support it. The RBC Digital Technology team is focused on understanding our client’s needs to deliver scalable automated solutions. Our technologists design, develop and support the services we own. We’re building a team who is not afraid to challenge the status quo; embraces innovation; and excited to bring a fresh perspective. We’ve set out to simplify our client’s interactions by building a unified platform, custom tailored to our client’s needs.

We’re looking for a talented and passionate Senior Front End Developer to join our team. Our team is designed to deliver products throughout the client’s journey, not projects; each squad is setup for agility and continuous delivery, and then empowered with the autonomy to chart their own course to success.  As an engineer you will work as part of a small, autonomous, agile team to deliver both internal and external applications; built on a modern hybrid cloud platform using the latest micro-services architecture. We believe in the power of working together, you’ll get to work with your peers, business partners and RBC’s tech community and you’ll have the opportunity to grow and expand your capabilities. Join our team today and magnify your impact influencing the future of banking on a global scale.

What will you do?

  • You will be creating new customer-facing applications using the latest technologies which will shape the future of banking for RBC

  • Work within an Agile product team comprised of technical, product and business team members to deliver exceptional products

  • Design and develop code structures to promote reusability across many applications

  • Collaborate with the team to design and implement software logic following current best practices

  • Mentor and coach others on the team and practice pair-programming

  • Provide guidance and direction to ensure high code quality with a rapidly changing Enterprise application suite

  • Stay open-minded and look beyond your stack to solve complex problems

  • You will actively seek out knowledge about new technologies and how they can be used to solve current and foreseeable challenges

  • Collaborate with the other developers on the team to define and integrate REST APIs with the UI components

What do you need to succeed?

  • B.S. degree in Computer Science or related technical field with equivalent practical experience.

  • 5+ years experience with JavaScript

  • Experience working within professional software engineering practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source code management, build processes and testing

  • Experience supporting production-level software.

  • Advanced knowledge and experience with Web UI frameworks including Angular and experience in other frameworks is valuable (ie. React, Vue)

  • Experience with querying and consuming from a REST backend

  • Experience with code merging and branching methodologies using Git

  • Experience working within an Agile product team

Nice-to-have:

  • You\'ve built or contributed to an open source project

  • Experience with a design system and/or component library

  • Object Oriented coding practices, including strong design patterns knowledge, refactoring, clean code

  • Understanding of DevOps deployment processes and technologies; Docker, Jenkins etc.

  • Experience in BDD and TDD methodologies

What’s in it for you? 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Member of the front-end chapter, which provides training, events, and other opportunities for learning. You will also have an opportunity to share your work and experience with your peers

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • A world-class training program in financial services

  • Flexible work/life balance options​

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

  • 3+ years experience with Java 8+ and Spring Framework (Spring Boot) and/or nodeJS
  • 2+ years experience developing distributed cloud applications (Pivotal Cloud Foundry, Openshift, Docker)
  • Hands on experience designing, developing, testing and troubleshooting RESTful API and interface specifications (Swagger, RAML, SOAP)
  • Experience working with DevOps pipelines (Git, Maven, Jenkins), continuous integration/delivery, automated testing (unit, functional, performance)
  • Experience working with security gateways and protocols (JWT, Oauth2.0, SSL Certificates)
  • Experience working within professional software engineering practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source code management, build processes and testing
  • Experience with code merging and branching methodologies using Git and code release process.
  • Working knowledge of web-based application architectures and frameworks (including Angular or React) and the way it integrates with services.
  • Leverage Open Source technology and contribute to open source where possible
  • Experience supporting production-level software (Splunk, Dynatrace).
  • Solid experience with abstraction and applying it to learning new languages
  • Ability to simplify complex problems and communicate them in plain language

Nice-to-have:

  • Object Oriented coding practices, including strong design patterns knowledge, refactoring, clean code.
  • Experience working with Kafka, MySQL, Non-relational databases, Caching and
  • Experience in BDD and TDD methodologies
  • Working experience in one or more of:
    • algorithm design and optimization
    • large-scale systems
    • parallel or distributed systems
    • RDBMS and/or modern scale-out repositories (MySQL, MongoDB, Redis)
  • Experience building message driven architectures (Kafka)
  • Micro-service design and implementation (load balancing, discovery, resiliency)

What’s in it for you? 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. item.title: Senior Front End Developer (OMNI)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Front End Developer (OMNI)

Job Description

What if you could use your technology skills to work on products that make an impact by delivering unforgettable client experiences? We’ve moved beyond digitizing simple banking capabilities towards an end-to-end transformation of our customers’ journeys. We’re a collaborative team with our sights set on building the tech stack of the future with modern, flexible architecture by building once and reusing across channels.

Between releases and working on really cool stuff, we eat, sleep, and breathe agile: Build. Test. Learn. It’s our way of life, and we believe technical excellence and thoughtful design enhance this way of working. We’re keenly motivated to step up to the plate and take ownership of our work: we do it with pride. We care deeply about the outcomes, but how we get there matters too. That’s why we’re looking for a talented Senior Front-End Developer to join us on our journey.

This is where you come in: In this role on our Design Platform team, you’ll help us scale product design across the organization to deliver better, more consistent experiences for our customers.

You’ll also facilitate the discovery and development of design best practices across the organization, and manifest these through components, patterns and guidelines within our design system, contribution process, design tooling and education programs.

Backed by the might of our teams, you’ll have the tools and resources needed to achieve extraordinary results that make a significant impact extending beyond the boundaries of traditional Front-End Developer roles.

WHAT YOU’LL DO:

Knowledge Sharing and Learning

  • Lead the training of developers across RBC by coordinating internal and external seminars and workshops
  • Liaise with the Omni Talent Squad to bring in external programs/vendors for training and development
  • Foster a culture of self-improvement and learning by encouraging developers to leverage their “10%” chapter time for innovation
  • Lead meetings and activities that enable cross-squad and cross-journey knowledge sharing to solve common problems
  • Represent RBC (attend and present at) external and internal technical conferences 

Operational and Systems Design

  • Build and maintain a design system for multiple brands and platforms
  • Guide team members with advice and techniques that improve their understanding and mastery of design systems and design operations
  • Inform best practices and development guidelines across the Design and Omni organization
  • Determine strategies for enabling the collection, refinement, governance and distribution of shared patterns and components
  • Inform measurement practices for determining the efficacy of UI components
  • Ensure that components meet high standards of accessibility and inclusivity

Technical Leadership

  • Work within an Agile product team comprising technical, product and business team members to deliver exceptional products
  • Research and influence industry trends within your chapter’s competency and ensure that Omni is using the best available tools and techniques
  • Establish technical standards and best practices for journeys and squads
  • Drive innovation with chapter members through meetings and activities (code reviews, demos, meetups, conferences, etc.)

​​​​​​​

Relationships and Communications

  • Act as a trusted technical partner to the Omni business by providing guidance and technical direction
  • Maintain relationships with developers and teams across T&O and P&CB to help prioritize and drive Omni objectives
  • Distill technical details into human terms with excellent communication skills
  • Build relationships with stakeholders and across teams

​​​​​​​

WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED? 

  • 5+ years of experience combined in Programming, Saas/ PaaS applications, front-end engineering, test-driven development, and architecture design principles
  • Strong ability and proven experience in building and developing a high performing team/culture, and a strong inclination for continuous learning and growth (e.g., keeping up to date on latest technology trends, industry research)
  • Experience building components for design systems in delivering exceptional front-end components
  • Strong communication, workshop facilitation, problem-solving/probing skills with ability to build relationships, lead teams, and actively collaborate with cross-organization teams
  • Track record of anticipating and designing solutions to overcome technical problems
  • Built or significantly improved large technological areas or architecture initiatives

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU? 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. 

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Opportunity to work on really cool stuff and make a difference
  • Work in a fun, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Access to world-class learning resources and relevant programs

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

Job Title

Senior Back End Developer (OMNI)

What if you could use your technology skills to work on products that make an impact when it comes to delivering unforgettable client experiences? We’ve moved away from digitizing simple banking capabilities, to end-to-end transformation of our customers journeys. Between daily deployments and working on really cool stuff, we eat, sleep, and breathe agile — Build. Test. Learn. It’s our way of life, and we believe technical excellence and thoughtful design enhance this way of working. We are keenly motivated to step up to the plate and take ownership of our work: we do it with pride. We care deeply about the outcomes, but how we get there matters too.  That’s why we’re looking for talented individuals to join us on our journey to revolutionizing the digital financial industry. 

What we\'re looking for:

As the Senior Back End Developer, you’ll work as part of a small, autonomous, agile team to deliver both internal and external applications. We are looking for top notch software engineers who are great team players and obsessive about the quality of their code and delivered service. You’ll have the opportunity to grow and expand your capabilities within the RBC development community as learning and knowledge sharing will be second nature while applying your technical know-how to ensure that RBC is on the leading edge of development practices.

Backed by the might of our teams, you’ll have the tools and resources needed to achieve extraordinary results that render a significant impact extending beyond the boundaries of traditional engineering roles. If you’re a strong leader with proven experience evaluating industry best-of-class technical approaches—we have a spot for you on our team.

What will you do:

  • You will be creating new services and customer-facing applications using the latest technologies which will shape the future of banking for RBC
  • Collaborate with other developers on the team to model and design new API interfaces
  • Develop and support highly scalable, high performance APIs within an Agile development team
  • Ensure high code quality through automated unit and functional testing
  • Automate processes within the development pipeline; identify opportunities for efficiency gains and reducing time-to-market, and enabling continuous delivery
  • Design and develop code structures to promote reusability across many applications
  • Work within an agile product team comprised of technical, product and business team members to deliver exceptional products.
  • Lead and mentor other developers to elevate the entire team’s skillset and mindset. Coach others on the team and practice peer-programming.
  • Stay open-minded and look beyond your stack to solve complex problems
  • You will actively seek out knowledge about new technologies and how they can be used to solve current and foreseeable challenges
  • Excellent communication including the ability to distill technical details into human terms

What do you need to succeed? 

  • B.S. degree in Computer Science or related technical field (e.g. EE, physics or mathematics), or equivalent practical experience.
  • +3 years experience with Java 8+ and Spring Framework (Spring Boot)
  • +2 years experience developing distributed cloud applications (Pivotal Cloud Foundry, Openshift, Docker)
  • Hands on experience designing, developing, testing and troubleshooting RESTful API and interface specifications (Swagger, RAML, SOAP)
  • Experience working with DevOps pipelines (Git, Maven, Jenkins), continuous integration/delivery, automated testing (unit, functional, performance)
  • Experience working with security gateways and protocols (JWT, Oauth2.0, SSL Certificates)
  • Experience working within professional software engineering practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source code management, build processes and testing
  • Experience with code merging and branching methodologies using Git and code release process.
  • Working knowledge of web-based application architectures and frameworks (including Angular or AngularJS) and the way it integrates with services.
  • Leverage Open Source technology and contribute to open source where possible
  • Experience supporting production-level software (Splunk, Dynatrace).
  • Solid experience with abstraction and applying it to learning new languages
  • Ability to simplify complex problems and communicate them in plain language

Nice-to-have:

  • Object Oriented coding practices, including strong design patterns knowledge, refactoring, clean code.
  • Experience working with Kafka, MySQL, Non-relational databases, Caching
  • Experience working with BPMN tools like Camunda, Pega, or others
  • Experience in BDD and TDD methodologies
  • Working experience in one or more of:
    • Algorithm design and optimization
    • Large-scale systems
    • Parallel or distributed systems
    • RDBMS and/or modern scale-out repositories (MySQL, MongoDB, Redis)
    • Experience building message driven architectures (Kafka)
    • Micro-service design and implementation (load balancing, discovery, resiliency)

What’s in it for you? 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, fair compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who help your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Lead Full Stack Developer (OMNI)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Lead Full Stack Developer (OMNI)

Job Description

Our clients are unique and their digital banking experience should be one-of-a-kind. At RBC Digital, we want our clients to feel empowered when they interact with us. We’re investing in technologies and data insights to evolve as our clients do. We’ve joined our product, design and technology teams to collaborate to deliver an innovative personalized user experience. Being a part of our Digital Team means you’ll join a culture of creativity, curiosity, and continuous learning.

We’re envisioning the future of banking and building the core platforms to support it. The RBC Digital Technology team is focused on understanding our client’s needs to deliver scalable automated solutions. Our technologists design, develop and support the services we own. We’re building a team who is not afraid to challenge the status quo; embraces innovation; and excited to bring a fresh perspective. We’ve set out to simplify our client’s interactions by building a unified platform, custom tailored to our client’s needs.

What is the opportunity?

We’re looking for a talented and passionate Senior Full Stack Developer to join our team. Our team is designed to deliver products throughout the client’s journey, not projects; each squad is setup for agility and continuous delivery, and then empowered with the autonomy to chart their own course to success.  As an engineer you will work as part of a small, autonomous, agile team to deliver both internal and external applications; built on a modern hybrid cloud platform using the latest micro-services architecture. We believe in the power of working together, you’ll get to work with your peers, business partners and RBC’s tech community and you’ll have the opportunity to grow and expand your capabilities. Join our team today and magnify your impact influencing the future of banking on a global scale.

What will you do?

  • You will be creating new services and customer-facing applications using the latest technologies which will shape the future of banking for RBC
  • Collaborate with other developers on the team to model and design new API interfaces.
  • Develop and support highly scalable, high performance APIs within an Agile development team
  • Ensure high code quality through automated unit and functional testing

  • Lead and mentor other developers to elevate the entire team’s skillset and mindset. Coach others on the team and practice peer-programming.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • B.S. degree in Computer Science or related technical field with equivalent practical experience.
  • 3+ years experience with JavaScript
  • 3+ years experience with Java 8+ and Spring Framework (Spring Boot) and/or nodeJS
  • 2+ years experience developing distributed cloud applications (Pivotal Cloud Foundry, Openshift, Docker)
  • Hands on experience designing, developing, testing and troubleshooting RESTful API and interface specifications (Swagger, RAML, SOAP)
  • Experience working with DevOps pipelines (Git, Maven, Jenkins), continuous integration/delivery, automated testing (unit, functional, performance)
  • Working knowledge of web-based application architectures and frameworks (including Angular or React) and the way it integrates with services.

Nice-to-have:

  • Experience working with Kafka, MySQL, Non-relational databases, Caching and
  • Experience in BDD and TDD methodologies
  • Working experience in one or more of:
    • algorithm design and optimization
    • large-scale systems
    • parallel or distributed systems
    • RDBMS and/or modern scale-out repositories (MySQL, MongoDB, Redis)
  • Experience building message driven architectures (Kafka)
  • Micro-service design and implementation (load balancing, discovery, resiliency)

What’s in it for you? 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

item.title: Senior QE Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior QE Analyst

Job Description

WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?

RBC is seeking to hire Sr. QE Analyst. Your objective is to ensure the QE processes are well defined, executed and continually monitored. Working with different project teams to ensure functional/regression test suite is up to date and remains relevant. You will be accountable for driving quality and champion defect prevention/early defect detection and maximizing test coverage.

  • Provide support to QE Lead/Manager on estimation and work allocation for the team acting as a release lead in full capacity.
  • Support the stakeholders in achieving their strategic goals for the product/project team by providing technical/QE support.
  • Provide recommendations and contribute to test strategy & technical solutions in area of expertise, including leading QE work streams.
  • Effectively communicates and builds rapport with team members, stakeholders and business partners using a variety of techniques and collaboration from initiation to close.

WHAT WILL YOU DO?

  • Automate assigned areas/feature using existing Framework and provide the test estimations.
  • Responsible for designing the effective test cases using Model based approach and test design techniques.
  • Responsible for overall quality of testing deliverables/activities
  • Prepare daily/weekly status and milestone reports on projects under test deliverables.
  • Create and review Test Plan/Execution document, Test Suite, Traceability matrix etc. and walkthrough with different teams, plan and coordinate defect triage.
  • Support the implementation of the QE Program and overall QE process and standards through continuous test execution and reporting.
  • Leverages the existing automation frameworks, tools and artefacts to ensure testing process is continuous, comprehensive and fully autonomous.
  • Lead independent releases including integration testing and bring up risks to QE Lead/Manager in a timely fashion and prepare for contingency.

WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED?

 Must have:

  • Typically requires 5-7 years of QE related experience
  • Good knowledge of Testing Life Cycle, SDLC and Defect Management processes for application support and development.
  • Expert level knowledge with QE Processes, Methodologies and Test Design techniques with hands on experience on ALM, JIRA and Confluence.
  • Experience with Iterative Waterfall and Agile Project Methodologies.
  • Good experience in Mobile automation testing.
  • Strong problem solving, design, and analytical skills and out of the box thinking coming up with creative solutions on testing approach in critical timelines.
  • Experience in a variety of test automation frameworks/tools e.g., (SoapUI, Selenium, Appium, UFT/Lean UFT/RestAssured/Robot Framework, TestNG) and script development using scripting languages (e.g., Perl, Python, Bash, etc.)
  • Expert knowledge of industry practices with focus on Agile, DevOps, environments and test integration.
  • Hands-on experience in developing testing strategies, executing manual/automated test cases and reporting to senior management for complex multi-application system integrations.
  • Minimum 5 years of experience in a QA/test environment with a focus on technical, automated testing in a variety of environments (cloud, distributed and mainframe, business workflows and services/APIs, databases).
  • Excellent communication skills and effective negotiation skills.

Nice-to-have:

  • QA related certification. E.g. ISTQB, Agile testing, Mobile Testing etc.
  • Experience in Model based testing and tools such as ConformIQ, Hexawise etc.
  • Computer Engineering, Computer Science, related (technical) degree/diploma or equivalent experience(e.g., Java, C, SQL DB querying)

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Senior Data Scientist
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Data Scientist

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

In this role as a Data Scientist, you will analyze, design, and implement data science/machine learning solutions using state of the art tools and algorithms. The group specializes in taking full advantage of large data sets to explore and discover new insights that would have not been possible with traditional analytics. You will get the opportunity to work on cutting-edge technology and complex problems that generate significant value and have a high long-term impact on the bank’s growth.

What will you do?

  • Work on challenging business problems by leveraging large RBC data, translating them into machine learning problems and applying advanced machine learning algorithms to generate business value
  • Partner with different business units to understand their problems and requirements, leverage internal RBC / external data to build robust machine learning solutions and communicate insights, results with business
  • Analyze, clean, and process large structured or unstructured datasets and generate useful business insights that drive decision making
  • Apply supervised or unsupervised learning algorithms, validate models, explain model predictions and generate reports for businesses
  • Collaborate with data engineering/ software engineering teams to deploy models to production

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Masters or PhD in a quantitative discipline such as computer science, mathematics, statistics, or engineering
  • Theoretical as well as practical knowledge of deep learning techniques applied in Computer Vision
  • 2+ years of expert level programming experience in Python (preferable) or R is a must - ability to write production-level code and documentation
  • 2+ years’ experience working with large datasets - exploring and understanding data, cleaning and pre-processing, performing exploratory data analysis, generating business insights and communicating them in a clear, concise manner
  • 2+ years’ experience developing and deploying models in production for real business problems
  • Knowledge of standard machine learning libraries like numpy, pandas, scikit learn and visualization packages like seaborn or matplotllib,etc and machine learning algorithms like logistic regression, tree based models, decision trees, random forests, etc
  • Experience working with version control - git and linux

Nice to have

  • Have experience working in NLP - text data preparation, word embeddings, RNN’s etc
  • Previous experience in deep learning for understanding Aerial Imagery
  • Experience working with big data, pyspark, scala
  • Experience in developing attrition models with proven success. Publications in machine learning and artificial intelligence.
  • Passion for synthetic data set generation and differential privacy based on new deep learning based techniques

What’s in it for you?

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Opportunity to work on very high impact visible business problems that are intended to improve existing business processes significantly
  • Gaining real world experience of working on challenging business problems and working in a high performing team
  • Learning new technologies, methods and applying them to deliver business value
  • Networking and building lasting relationships in the bank, gaining from mentorship or coaching
  • Collaborative work environment, supportive team and work life balance

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same.  Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

RBC exige, à titre de condition d’emploi, que tous les candidats retenus aux États-Unis ou au Canada soient entièrement vaccinés contre la COVID-19 avant leur date d’entrée en fonction. Il est possible qu’ils aient à présenter une preuve vaccinale. Des mesures raisonnables d’adaptation sont offertes lorsque la loi l’exige

item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Architect

Job Description

  •  WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?


    The RAMPP group within QTS is looking to expand its Architecture team. The group provides risk, pricing and trade processing solutions to our Capital Markets business, and has numerous projects which require technology management and architectural governance. These projects vary in scale from individual business asks within a single application to enterprise-wide multi-year initiatives. In this role you will be responsible for assisting teams in selecting the appropriate technologies and ensuring their design aligns to our architecture strategy.


    WHAT WILL YOU DO?


    •    Understand the Enterprise and QTS standard technologies and usage patterns, act as an SME on this for our application teams, and work with them on applying this to their systems.
    •    Identify need for common technical solutions; develop and problem solve them. CICD and Cloud capabilities are expected to be a particular focus.
    •    Establish strong working relationships across business units and platforms to build influence and impact with key business partners. Collaborate with groups to define and achieve deliverables and ensure initiatives are meeting both our architecture and business outcomes.
    •    Facilitate and lead design discussions in an objective fashion to bring groups to a shared agreement on architecture decisions.
    •    Manage the implementation of multiple concurrent initiatives of varying complexity in a time efficient manner.  Monitor and control activities according to plan.  
    •    Contribute to ongoing administrative program activities as required.

    WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED?


     Must have:
    •    4-5+ years of professional experience in a developer and/or architect role
    •    A strong understanding of technology and/or financial services industry.
    •    Undergraduate degree coupled with change management experience in complex programs with high frequency of requests and multiple priorities.
    •    Demonstrated ability in written and oral communication skills along with strong presentation skills. Ability to determine the information and communication needs of the stakeholders and project.
    •    Strong organizational, project management and time management capabilities.

item.title: Cloud Engineer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Cloud Engineer

Job Description

  • What is the opportunity? 

    In this role you’ll be supporting cutting-edge cloud platforms and services to enable our users to evolve their business at scale by designing, implementing and maintaining strategic Cloud Platforms used by multiple application teams across the Bank. You will have the ability to influence technical design and provide solutions to challenges that will add value to our customers and contribute to the success of the organization.

    What will you do? 

    • Design and build highly scalable, secure, and highly available architectures
    • Promote automation and infrastructure best practices
    • Contribute to a team of like-minded platform engineers building platforms in Azure, AWS and GCP public clouds
    • Fearlessly face challenging technical problems, use your superpowers to solve them, and help your peers by sharing your unique solutions
    • You will minimize risk of reliability related failure outcomes as pertaining to durability, availability, performance, and correctness
    • Write code and scripts to automate infrastructure and other common workflows
    • Participate in on-call rotation to provide application support, incident management, and troubleshooting

    What do you need to succeed?

    Must Have 

    • Experience with Infrastructure Automation and Infrastructure as Code
    • Proficiency with any public cloud (Azure/AWS/GCP) services and infrastructure.
    • 3+ years of experience working with one or more of: Python, GO, Ruby, Java
    • A passion for making developers more efficient through DevOps, CI/CD, and Infrastructure as Code

    Nice to Have 

    • Experience in Kubernetes (Building Operators and managing production workloads)
    • Knowledge of SRE principles
    • An aptitude for learning and solutions design

    What’s in it for you? 

    We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

    • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
    • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
    • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
    • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
    • A world-class training program in financial services
    • Flexible work/life balance options

Logistics Coordinator

  • What is the opportunity?

    Coordinate the implementation and maintenance of application and infrastructure initiatives for Deskside Support Services.  Implementation activities will be based upon specific business initiatives and/or national implementations planned by Portfolio Management Office (PMO) and Physical Network Distribution (PND).  Responsibilities include the coordination of implementation activities, positioning strategies and benefits with the business unit, and proactive follow-up of both product and processes. 

    What will you do?

  • Responsible for ensuring all procedures and documentation are complete as it relates to the planning of application and infrastructure implementations.

  • Works to ensure that schedules, plans and commitments are aligned with the business unit and T&O priorities with no overlaps or gaps.

  • Monitors each implementation, ensuring all technical problems (related to both software and equipment operations) are documented, corrected or escalated following the established procedures for resolution within a reasonable time frame.

  • Takes leadership role for all related implementation activities and ensures that plans/updates are regularly communicated to all necessary members of Deskside Support Services and departments such at TSD, GU, etc.

  • Directs allocated DSS and third party resources in the fulfillment of project activities, providing periodic performance feedback.

  • Partners with Portfolio Management Office (PMO) and Physical Network Distribution (PND) and/or takes the lead role in ensuring the Implementation activities are completed for new initiatives.

  • Proactively identifies efficiency and effectiveness opportunities.
