item.title: Data Scientist
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Data Scientist

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Who wouldn\'t want to be a part of a fantastic team of Data Scientists?  At RBC, our Data Science teams offer the opportunity to leverage RBC’s data assets to develop innovative solutions in support of RBCs big data strategy. This position is an essential part to the bank as you develop next-generation applications to meet our customers’ needs. By joining the RBC team as a Data Scientist, you will have the opportunity to analyze, design and implement data solutions to assist all business customers.

What will you do?

  • Utilize the latest technologies available, designing and building data solutions to meet business needs
  • Be an active contributor to not only your individual team, but to the RBC development community
  • Constantly seek out better ways to do things, new tools, new technologies, new processes
  • Work on transformational projects delivering new value
  • Work as part of an agile team responsible for end-to-end delivery of business needs
  • Deploy production-scale solutions using the Hadoop Ecosystem, transforming statistical and machine learning models
  • Use business domain knowledge to independently lead the analytics process to identify valuable and innovative insights
  • Promote analytics across the enterprise to enable RBC to become a data-driven organization

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Programming skills in one or more of the following languages: Python or Scala
  • Experience utilizing SQL scripts/querying
  • Proficient in building statistical and machine learning models with complex and large datasets, including but not limited to: statistical modelling, supervised learning, clustering, regression, natural language processing, ensemble models (bagging, boosting), times-series analysis, experimental design (A/B testing), data visualization
  • Ability to data extract, transform, and load processes with a variety of data types
  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to stakeholders
  • Familiar with Big Data ecosystem

Nice-to-have

  • Experience with big data technologies, primarily in machine learning and statistics function
  • Exposure to Apache Spark, Hadoop ecosystem and cloud technologies, data serialization (JSON, Avro, Parquet)
  • Comfortable working in Linux environment
  • Experience with big data processing tools like Spark and Hive, GitHub functionality and workflow experience/exposure
  • Experience with messaging (Kafka) & working on Agile projects

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients succeed. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities and achieving success that is mutual. 

  • Continued career advancement opportunities
  • Exposure to strong mentorship and leadership examples
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Opportunities to be a valuable member of a close-knit, collaborative team that encourages networking

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Engineering Manager I - RBC Ventures (Ownr) [TEST]
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Engineering Manager I - RBC Ventures (Ownr) [TEST]

Job Description

RBC Ventures is a new kind of business – one that marries the strength of one of the world’s most trusted and successful financial institutions with a mission to reimagine the role we play in people’s lives – to move RBC ‘beyond banking’. We’re building a world-class organization focused on designing exceptional experiences, exploring new business models and creating exponential value. In 2020, we were named by Fast Company as one of the 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators and we’re looking for team members with the curiosity to explore, the capabilities to build and capacity to help us deliver our mission.

What is the opportunity?

We are looking for a talented engineering lead and passionate team-player to join the Ownr family as an Engineering Manager I. You\'ll be building the next evolution of our platform as we move to provide extensive new capabilities to business owners, working alongside a close-knit group of fun and ambitious engineers, product managers, and designers.

Your experience will help set the technical direction of our applications, infrastructure, and pipelines and help our team define how we will leverage the latest tooling and best practices. As part of a young and growing team, you will have daily opportunities to lead and mentor other developers, exercising your skills as a seasoned technical leader, uniquely in both startup and enterprise environments.

What will you do?

  • Manage teams of skilled JavaScript developers who work on a rapidly evolving consumer-facing platform, and take responsibility for their mentorship and growth.
  • Provide technical leadership and hands-on contribution of the software that supports the business and for monitoring and maintaining that software in production.
  • Co-ordinate delivery of major product milestones and manage stakeholders at Ownr, RBC Ventures, and RBC Bank.
  • Establish the patterns, architecture, and practices that the team will follow in building modern and best-in-class software.
  • Be responsible for finding opportunities to iteratively improve our technology and delivery processes.

About you

  • You embrace an owner\'s mindset: continually striving to make an impact; investing time, energy, and capital as if they were your own; and understanding that no part of the business is outside the scope of your position.
  • You have significant production JavaScript experience, and have formed clear opinions about how different development patterns and practices can both negatively and positively impact your ability to be productive in a codebase, and by extension, the reliability of a business\' software platform.
  • You have significant experience working with modern infrastructure and pipelines. You can quickly grok a complex application landscape but also strive to simplify where possible.
  • You innately understand web/application security and the importance of data privacy.
  • You keep yourself up to date on the latest trends in the ever-changing open source development space and understand where they should (or shouldn\'t) be applied in the team\'s context.
  • You behave proactively when confronted with unforeseen challenges and complexity in your projects. Your team members can clearly understand the state of your work, your delivery plans, and your ideas for improving the business\' software, technology processes, and team culture.

What do you need to succeed?

Must have

  • 4+ years of solid hands-on programming experience, with a sizable portion in JavaScript, TypeScript, GraphQL, React, and Postgres.
  • 2+ years of leading, managing, and mentoring technical teams.
  • Experience planning, documenting, implementing, and maintaining scaled web applications.
  • Experience working with and setting up modern software development best practices (source control, automated testing, CI/CD pipelines, Docker, declarative infrastructure, etc).
  • Experience building production systems, with an understanding of the deployment, monitoring, and security best practices required to run production software


Nice to have

  • Post-secondary degree or diploma in a computer or design related program.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

VSTECHNOLOGY

RBC Ventures

item.title: Full Stack Developer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Full Stack Developer

Job Description

  • What is the opportunity?

    At RBC, our purpose is clear: to help our clients thrive, and our communities prosper. To achieve that we need great talent. This is why RBC is focused on identifying, attracting and hiring talent and diverse individuals to join our high performing teams. We are currently building a pool of Full Stack Developer candidates for opportunities across Corporate Systems. If you are interested in being considered for a future opportunity, please apply and we will contact you to discuss new positions when they become available.

    Corporate Systems helps RBC functions & businesses achieve business objectives through app development & technology support. We’re also the center of excellence for employee social collaboration & mobile apps, and also build apps that support managing the risk of the bank. We’re building a team that embraces innovation and enthusiasm to bring a fresh perspective. We’ve been on journeys to build out high performing, highly resilient technology platforms that can grow with the continuous demands from Group Risk, Human Resources, Chief Administrative Office & Audit, Capital Markets, P&CB and Wealth.  We’re looking for talented and passionate technologists to join our team.  With a developer mind-set you will work as part of an agile team to deliver high performing applications built on cloud platforms with streaming technologies. We believe in continuous growth and expanding your capabilities. Join our team today and have a big impact influencing the strength of our advanced insight and analytics.

    What will you do?

    • Develop and support highly scalable, high performance components within an Agile development team

    • Ensure high code quality through automated unit and functional testing

    • Automate processes within the development pipeline; identify opportunities for efficiency gains and reducing time-to-market, and enabling continuous delivery

    • Design and develop code structures to promote reusability across many applications

    • Lead and mentor other developers to elevate the entire team’s skillset and mind-set. Coach others on the team.

    • Be open-minded and look beyond your stack to solve complex problems

    • Proactively seek out knowledge about new technologies and how they can be used to solve current and foreseeable challenges

    • Communicate effectively and distil technical details into human terms

    What do you need to succeed?

    Must-have

    • 2+ years’ programming experience with any of: Java/JavaScript/Typescript
    • Writing/understand database queries (SQL and/or No-SQL)
    • Object Oriented design and development

    Nice-to-have

    • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Math or equivalent
    • 2+ years’ experience with SQL
    • 2+ years’ experience with development using JavaScript frameworks such as Angular.js/React/Node.js,
      or Java Frameworks like Spring (MVC, Security, JPA, and/or Boot),
      or experience with Apache Hadoop/Hive/Spark/Scala or other big-data platform technology/tools
    • 2+ years’ experience on Unix/Linux OS
    • 2+ years’ DevOps experience with continuous integration/delivery best-practices, technologies and tools such as Subversion/GitHub, Jenkins, Nexus, JIRA, Confluence, Urban Code Deploy, SonarQube, Checkmarx
    • 2+ years’ experience with containerization tools and technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes, RedHat OpenShift Container Platform (OCP)
    • Technical Certifications: AWS, or Azure

    What’s in it for you? 

    We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

    • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
    • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
    • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
    • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
    • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities
    • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients

    JOB SUMMARY

    City:  Toronto

    Address:  155 Wellington Street West, 9th Floor

    Work Hours/Week:  37.5

    Work Environment:  Office

    Employment Type:  Permanent

item.title: Full Stack Developer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Full Stack Developer

Job Description

What is the opportunity?


RBC’s Data and Analytics are looking to expand our web development team in Calgary, AB. You’ll be working as part of a small, autonomous, agile team to deliver both internal and external web applications.
 
What will you do?

  • Work within an Agile product team to design, develop, test and maintain web applications.
  • Contribute towards the creation of intuitive, robust, and reusable user interfaces using modern frameworks.
  • Gather functional requirements and translate them into technical specifications. This includes interfacing with project managers, business analysts and end users.
  • Collaborate with other team members on resolving technical issues, improving current products and developing new ones. 
  • Prepare and present completed work to leaders as well as business partners.

 

What do you need to succeed?

  • A creative problem solver that can develop a plan, take ownership and deliver solutions
  • A team player, technical advocate, keen to flush out and share ideas with your team
  • An exceptional communicator able to articulate technical issues in plain language
  • Value your team’s success as much as your own as we celebrate and move forward as a team
  • Passionate about clean code and best practices
  • You keep up to date on frontend and backend development trends 
  • You understand web/application security and the importance of data privacy
  • You bring new ideas and solutions to the team to help solve our challenges

 
Must-Have:

  • 4+ years web development experience.
  • 3+ years of experience with Angular, React or Vue (Angular preferred) .
  • Experience building data services and managing application state using rxjs or similar.
  • Experience with REST API/Micro services, Spring Boot (2.x), SQL.
  • A deep knowledge of modern styling tools – SASS/SCSS, Flexbox, Animations etc.
  • A great eye for detail – the ability to transform high fidelity prototypes into pixel-perfect user interfaces.

 
Nice To Have:

  • Experience building APIs using NodeJS, .NET Core, Java
  • Experience building interactive data visualisations using Highcharts, D3 or other charting libraries. 
  • Experience with Continuous Integration tools - Jenkins, GitHub, Automated Testing tools, or similar tools.
  • Experience with Cloud-based environments and tools
  • Experience with Docker

Job Title

Data Engineer

Job Description

Data Engineer

.

What is the opportunity?

Excited by Data?  This is your opportunity to join the RBC data transformation.  We believe that Hadoop is a compute grid and not just a data store, and that utilizing the right tools for the job is a priority.  We are a team that believes being agile a way of thinking, and not a process to follow.  We believe in going big, pushing the boundaries and daring to fail and that the community is greater than any hero and that competency is greater than any corporate title. 

 

What will you do?

  • Be an active contributor to not only your individual team, but to the RBC development community
  • Constantly seek out better ways to do things, new tools, new technologies, new processes

item.title: Java Developer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Java Developer

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The RBC Team in Halifax will be hiring for multiple Developer and Engineer roles on the Financial Crimes, Finance IT, Risk IT, Fraud and Insurance teams. This role will require you to be located in the Halifax / Nova Scotia region and be able to commute to the office if needed. As a DevOps Engineer you provide support for a suite of business mission-critical and complex applications, understanding both front and back-end of the applications. The technology platform spans the breadth of Windows and Linux platforms, Python / Java environments and MS SQL and Oracle platforms.

 

What will you do?

  • Develop automation and infrastructure as code to improve operational consistency and efficiency.
  • Debug and solve customer escalations from our internal Support team.
  • Contribute features that make the platform more self-service; improve diagnostics collection and reporting capabilities for the product.
  • Collaborate in a cross-functional team with leaders from Operations, Product and Security
  • Work with the Cloud Adoption and Support teams to ensure efficient service delivery and act as an escalation point for incidents
  • Support implementation of DevOPS practices and tools and review / write code in either Python, Java or shell scripting to support business needs and requirements.
  •  Work with developers to resolve their technical issue working with DevOps pipeline. Primary focus will be on RBC’s in-house developed pipeline portal.  You will ask get involved as a secondary technical support on integration with source code and artifact management, build and deploy tools, security scanning and collaboration tools.
  • Create and documentation code snippets for different languages that being supported by DevOps pipeline to help developers interacting and integrating with the pipeline
  • Learn new programing languages to be able helping developers using the pipeline

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Passion for debugging complex systems and have an eye for problems that occur at scale.
  • Curious about how things work and can dig deep into multiple levels of software stack -- networking, OS and application layer.
  • Experience writing scripts to automate operational tasks (eg. Shell, Ansible, Python).
  • A passion for making developers more efficient through DevOps, CI/CD, Automation and Infrastructure as Code principles
  • Strong understanding of at-least one high level programming language (ex. JAVA, Python, Go, etc.)
  • Ability to solve complex problems, strong data structure and algorithm concepts

 

Nice-to-have

  • Experience with SQL environments and SQL Query.
  • ITIL Framework
  • Experience with middleware technologies such as MQ, REST API’s 
  • Experience working in an agile environment
  • Experience with Kubernetes and/or OpenShift Container Platform
  • Technical documentation experience

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

 

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including great benefits, annual incentive program and recognition
  • Leaders who support your development
  • A dynamic, collaborative, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work and grow your career
  • Work-life integration
  • Positive work culture emphasizing diversity and inclusion, volunteerism and community involvement

item.title: Investment Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Investment Analyst

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As an Investment Analyst on the RBC Investment Management team you will provide sound advice with respect to the selection of assets based on the efficient analysis of investment products and opportunities.  You will also be responsible for analysis of credit as well as equities.

What will you do?

  • Analyze fixed income securities with respect to credit risk, pricing and outlook
  • Review of financial statements for corporate issues and country risk profiles for government bonds
  • Value listed companies through the use of valuation models and market information in order to determine the fair share price for buy and sell decisions
  • Seek out and recommend opportunities in the fixed income and equity space as well as identify negative trends early in order to recommend exiting of positions.
  • Make recommendations with respect to the selection of assets via the preparation of research reports and research updates
  • Provide market and economic information used to inform reports to the management committees of pension plans, savings plans and ESOPs regarding the performance of their portfolios
  • Ensure that ad hoc requests for information are handled courteously and in a timely manner

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Bachelor Degree in Business Administration with a major in Finance
  • Currently pursuing CFA qualification
  • Sound working knowledge of relevant regulations: The Insurance Act 1980; The Income Tax Act etc.
  • Familiar with local financial markets and some knowledge of the international markets
  • Keen understanding of economic developments and their impact on investment performance
  • At least three (3) years’ experience in a financial institution or in a position engaged in investment analysis

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • The advantage of working with a dynamic, collaborative, and high performing team where initiative and hard work are recognized and rewarded
  • Opportunities to build close relationships with clients

item.title: Senior Java Developer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Java Developer

Job Description

WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?


This role is a developer role for the RAMPP Global Trade Management IT team. You will work on various different projects enhancing existing functionality within the application and developing new functionality to improve the platform. You will have the opportunity to work closely with various FO/BO businesses and technology teams. 
 
WHAT WILL YOU DO? 


•    Participate in the design, implementation, test, delivery and maintenance for Global Trade Management Platform
•    Participate in project planning sessions with FO, BO, Ops, other teams, to analyze business requirements, any prevailing issues and carve out the progress path ahead
•    System design through well-defined interfaces across multiple components, code reviews and making decisions depending on resources/data/infrastructure availability/accessibility
•    Develop engineering services by ensuring the services and the components are well defined/modularised, reliable, actively monitored and reusable
•    Ensure quality and completeness of the product through code review, unit testing and documentation
•    Provide technical expertise to maximize efficiency, reliability, value from current infrastructure and emerging technologies, showing technical leadership and driving continuous improvement efforts
 
WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED?
 
Must have:
•    Bachelor degree in Computer Science or Information Systems.
•    2+ years’ hands on experience in designing and developing applications using Java 8 (or later) using spring framework
•    Good knowledge of relational databases and any messaging technology  ( e.g. Solace/IBM MQ)
•    Knack for writing clean, readable java code with unit tests
•    Ability to multi-task effectively and provide timely updates
 
Nice-to-have 
•    Understanding of the front office sales/trading flows, knowledge of the following financial systems: ICAP, Brokertec, MarketAxess, ESpeed, Tradeweb, Candeal, BGCC, CME, ION, TRAX, Omgeo CTM, Omgeo Oasys, Bloomberg and Murex. 
•    Knowledge of securities reference data across multiple asset classes such as FI Bonds, Mortgages, Equities, FX and Commodities.
•    Experience developing server side services leveraging the following APIs: Spring, Spring Boot, RESTful Webservices, Google Protobuf, Apache Avro, Hibernate 3.0 and Struts 2.0
•    Experience designing and implementing relational databases. Detailed understanding of SQL and data modeling, hands-on experience with MS SQL and Sybase.

What’s in it for you?


We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
•    A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
•    Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
•    Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
•    Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
•    A world-class training program in financial services
•    Flexible work/life balance options
•    Opportunities to do challenging work

Job Summary

Leads in the technical design and development of cross-functional, multi-platform application systems. Applies extensive, in-depth knowledge, skills, and practices to perform complex assignments.

HALIFAX, Nova Scotia, Canada

Canada

item.title: Senior Solutions Architect
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Solutions Architect

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As a Senior Solutions Architect for Advisor and ATM technologies, you will have the opportunity to define technical solutions for initiatives that evolve RBC P&CB’s ability to be the digitally enabled relationship bank it aims to. That involves continuous modernization; including bringing to life a new, large scale, CRM and advisor platform where integration and data migration are key components of overall solution.

If you are passionate about defining solution architectures which address the complexities of data management in a highly integrated environment, have experience on large data migration initiatives, and comfortable in working on an agile environment alongside with engineering teams, our team is looking for you.

You will be joining a dynamic and collaborative architecture team that provides thought leadership across Advisor and ATM technology solutions. In addition, you will be accountable for demonstrating our core RBC values and setting an example for the team through your energy, motivation, quality of outcomes, and engagement.

What will you do?

  • Define the overall solution architecture for initiatives within CRM platform, with particular focus on Data Migration and Data Loads, which will happening throughout program execution. Along with that, factor data management complexities on data management to keep processes that are happening across systems whole
  • Provide recommendations on products and solutions, and develop solution architecture sketch and design documentation for implementation projects
  • Build strong understanding of business domain functionality and technology options, in order to identify data considerations and requirements “trade-offs” to meet business objectives and technology evolution
  • Provide expert counseling and support to the development team on construction and maintenance of robust, integrated, secure and efficient applications supporting Advisor and ATM technologies
  • Prepare or contribute to a high level solution/design (Architecture Blueprint), which will evolve along with the initiative execution
  • Lead complex group meetings (including business and technology partners) for technical design, decision making, problem solving, implementation and strategic planning, providing technical leadership and design guidance as projects evolve and key decisions are needed

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Total relevant IT experience of 7-10 years in multiple IT areas, of which at least 3 years of architecture experience on large programs/projects
  • Advanced knowledge, experience, and understanding of architecture, application development, systems design, integration and data management involving on premise, cloud, and SaaS platforms
  • Solid experience with integration architecture, having designed solutions that use APIs/REST, Event Driven, and batch, and performing significant data manipulation/mapping/ETL
  • Experience in defining data migration strategies, factoring not only on ETL processes but overall and end-to-end design, including data quality and validation approaches
  • Capability to establish and maintain effective partnerships and relationships with global architecture areas, Application Development, T&O management, RBC business groups, Technology Infrastructure, and others

Nice-to-have

  • Experience with Salesforce Financial Services Cloud data model and integration options
  • Experience working as part of Agile teams
  • Financial services experience
  • Desire and ability to provides direction, expertise, feedback, coaching and development to build the capability of more junior staff
  • Strong analytical, consultative, and team communication / facilitation skills

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Director, HEF Acquisition
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director, HEF Acquisition

Job Description

  • Responsible for managing all aspects of key Client Acquisition Programs and driving origination growth across HEF distribution channels. 
  • Responsibilities include understanding key client needs, channel preferences, competitive landscape, and optimizing profitability across acquisition channels.
  • Responsible to work with key partners including Sales, Marketing, CXDI, Communications, Policy, Pricing, Credit Strategies, Risk (PM&CS and GRM) and Operations (CAC, Fulfillment) to ensure end-to-end management of each of the key programs. 
  • Responsible for HEF’s digital demand generation tools and activities.
  • Responsible to lead and optimize the effectiveness of key Client Acquisition Programs, including the assessment and development of potential new programs and innovative acquisition strategies.
  • In partnership with HEF Marketing, responsible to develop the strategy for marketing to drive demand generation for each of HEFs key client segments to achieve growth objectives.
  • Working with HEF Analytics, develop reporting and analytic capabilities that leverage data and analytics to identify insights that will drive strategies for business optimization, financial performance management, and product & customer profitability.

Job Summary

In this role, you will lead the overall HEF acquisition strategy, including evolving and developing innovative end-to-end HEF acquisition strategies across all HEF distribution channels and salesforces to drive market leading growth.
